definition: so close, yet worlds apart (idiom)
8 in. length unit of Zhou dynasty
a Chinese foot/one-third of a meter/a ruler/a tape-measure/one of the three acupoints for measuring pulse in Chinese medicine/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3]
one of the characters used to represent a musical note in gongche notation, 工尺譜|工尺谱[gong1 che3 pu3]
day/sky/heaven
border/horizon/shore

sentences.english: But we were divided; he was as inscrutable as my headmaster.
sentences.chinese: 可是我們卻咫尺天涯，他象我的校長一樣不可理解。

sentences.english: If we have a day in the earth of the sides, the world is but a little place.
sentences.chinese: 如果我們有一天身處地球的兩側，咫尺天涯。

definition: very close/very near
see 天涯海角[tian1 ya2 hai3 jiao3]
separated by a generation/a lifetime ago
the other end of the world/a faraway place
ten thousand crags and torrents (idiom); the trials and tribulations of a long journey/a long and difficult road
(of relatives or friends) to live far apart from each other
kindred spirits
lit. flowers in a mirror and the moon reflected in the lake (idiom)/fig. an unrealistic rosy view/viewing things through rose-tinted spectacles/also written 水月鏡花|水月镜花
to take leave of/to leave/separation
to see each other/to meet in person
(literary) stranger
lit. the blue sea turned into mulberry fields (idiom)/fig. the transformations of the world
to meet (by chance)/to come across
separated by (distance or time etc)
a thousand miles/a thousand li (i.e. 500 kilometers)/a long distance
to part forever/eternal parting (i.e. death)
